item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. retronews: TUI browser for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet and mail readers (22 points | 4 comments)
2. Greppability is an underrated code metric (21 points | 10 comments)
3. Setting up a cache server for apt packages (14 points | 2 comments)
4. Departure Mono (100 points | 15 comments)
5. How to deadlock Tokio application in Rust with just a single mutex (7 points | 11 comments)
6. Licensing is packaging (3 points | 12 comments)
7. In Leak, Facebook Partner Brags About Listening to Your Phone’s Microphone to Serve Ads for Stuff You Mention (108 points | 123 comments)
8. Terminfo, at this point in time, is a net-negative on the terminal ecosystem (36 points | 13 comments)
9. Yubikey is the Digital Seat Belt We Need Today (3 points | 3 comments)
10. zigimports: Unused imports remover for Zig (4 points | no comments)
11. Python Programmers' Experience (9 points | no comments)
12. gRPC: 5 Years Later, Is It Still Worth It? (2 points | 1 comment)
13. Is this trait sealed, or not sealed — that is the question (2 points | no comments)
14. Implementation of Functional Languages Using Custom Hardware (1985) (8 points | 7 comments)
15. Unmaking the Makefiles - exorcising the Rust compiler test suite one file at a time (23 points | 12 comments)
16. My coding experience with LLM (11 points | 15 comments)
17. Coloring Korean Keystrokes: 11'172 Characters (16 points | no comments)
18. A TUI for sniffing network traffic using eBPF on Linux (1 points | no comments)
19. Differing Values In A Team Are Costly (31 points | 13 comments)
20. the limb-metaphor for simplicity (1 points | no comments)
21. An overview of Cloudflare's logging pipeline (3 points | 1 comment)
22. Make Your Own CDN With NetBSD (7 points | no comments)
23. exponential rate limiting (6 points | no comments)
24. ipmi (16 points | 8 comments)
25. IBM i for Wintel Hackers (1 points | no comments)
